intro: Buphthalmum garcinii, commonly known as the African sunflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and cylindrical stems. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically alternate, hairy, and have a distinctive heart-shaped base. Buphthalmum garcinii is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils.
